intro: Staehelina uniflosculosa, commonly known as the single-flower cluster plant, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a small herbaceous plant characterized by its compact growth habit and unique floral structure. The plant produces a single, elongated inflorescence that bears a cluster of small, tubular flowers. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
